dct_title_s: Five largest refugee origin countries {1951 to 2015}
dct_description_sm: A sublayer from migration routes for the five largest refugee populations in modern US history. This layer focuses on the five largest refugee origin countries from 1951 to 2015: 1. Afghanistan; 2. Syrian Arab Republic; 3. Iraq; 4. Ethiopia;  5. Somalia.
Source data: “Population Statistics.” The UN Refugee Agency, http://popstats.unhcr.org/en/persons_of_concern. Accessed 7 June 2016.
